meanings.definition: To establish a colony in (a place).
meanings.sent1: The explorers decided to colonize the new land they discovered.
meanings.sent2: Many people moved to the new continent to colonize it and start a new life.
meanings.sent3: The ants seemed to colonize the picnic area, claiming it as their own territory.
meanings.sent4: The idea of technology seemed to colonize every aspect of our daily lives.
meanings.sent5: The vines slowly began to colonize the garden, spreading their green tendrils everywhere.

meanings.definition: To settle in and establish control over (a place).
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization sought to colonize the neighboring lands to expand their empire.
meanings.sent2: The invading army aimed to colonize the region and impose their rule.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels seemed to colonize the backyard, claiming all the nuts for themselves.
meanings.sent4: The idea of fear seemed to colonize her mind, making her anxious about everything.
meanings.sent5: The weeds quickly began to colonize the garden, taking over the flower beds.
